title: The World of Words: Books
description: Reading is a timeless and powerful way to learn, escape reality, and grow as a person. Finding the right books and making time to read is a highly rewarding habit.
sentences: You can choose between physical books, e-books (on devices like Kindle), and audiobooks.
Goodreads is an excellent platform for tracking what you've read and getting recommendations.
Joining a local or online book club can make reading a more social and engaging activity.
Setting a small, achievable reading goal (e.g., 10 pages a day) can help build a consistent habit.
Exploring Indian authors offers unique perspectives and stories rooted in our culture.
dos: Try different genres to find out what you truly enjoy.
Visit local libraries and second-hand bookstores for hidden gems and budget-friendly options.
Make notes or highlight passages that resonate with you.
Give a book at least 50 pages before deciding to stop reading it.
donts: Don't feel pressured to finish a book you genuinely don't enjoy.
Don't let your 'to-be-read' pile become a source of stress.
Don't just stick to bestsellers; explore diverse and indie authors too.
Don't be afraid to re-read your favorite books.
